POSITION PURPOSE: The Assistant Athletic Director assists the School Athletic Director regarding the provision and supervision of athletic programs at the assigned school.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Thorough knowledge of all the Athletic Policies approved by the Orange County Schools Board of Education Thorough knowledge of existing system, state, and conference regulations Thorough understanding of the proper administrative chain of command Thorough knowledge of the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques associated with the athletic program Thorough knowledge of state and federal requirements regarding physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility for athletic participation Thorough knowledge of training rules and any other unique regulations about the various sports in which athletes are engaged Thorough knowledge of guidance and safeguards in place for the safety of athletes to address medical injuries and emergencies Thorough knowledge of the process for initiating policies and procedures applicable to the athletic program
EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Physical Education or a related field Minimum of three (3) years of classroom experience as a Physical Education teacher at the middle or high school level Any equivalent combination of training and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
CERTIFICATION AND LICENSE REQUIREMENTS NC Teacher Certification in Physical Education Must possess a valid driver's license issued by the NC Department of Motor Vehicles
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Master's Degree or additional credits beyond a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in a related field
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Responsible for the implementation by the entire staff of the sports program according to the OCS Athletic Policy and Board of Education policies 2. Implement existing system, state, and conference athletic regulations with fidelity 3. Utilize the proper administrative line of command and refer all requests and grievances through proper channels 4. Attend all required public/staff/departmental meetings 5. Establish the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques to be taught by staff 6. Design conferences, clinics, and staff meetings to ensure staff awareness of the overall program as needed 7. Encourage staff professional growth by encouraging clinic attendance according to local clinic policy 8. Delegate specific duties, supervise implementation, and at season's end, analyze staff effectiveness and help evaluate staff as needed 9. Maintain discipline, address grievances, and work to increase morale and cooperation 10. Assist the Athletic Director with scheduling, providing transportation, and communicating requirements for tournaments and special sporting events 11. Assist in the necessary preparation to hold scheduled sports events or practices, and adhere to scheduled facility times 12. Coordinate programs with maintenance and school employees 13. Provide documentation to fulfill state and system requirements concerning physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility 14. Provide proper safeguards for maintenance and protection of assigned equipment and facilities 15. Advise the Athletic Director and recommend policy, method, or procedural changes 16. Assist in the preparation and administration of the athletic program budget 17. Assist in the responsibility for the collection, safeguarding, and disbursement of athletic event funds and ticket sales 18. Recommend the purchase of equipment, supplies, and uniforms as appropriate for the health, safety, and welfare of student athletes 19. Responsible for the maintenance of the athletic equipment inventory 20. Responsible for the development of the master sports schedule and coordinate/confirm dates, times, and locations of all contests with opposing schools 21. Secure officials for all home contests 22. Arrange transportation for all away contests 23. Schedule and secure all workers (i.e., clock operators, bookkeepers, ticket takers, etc.) for home contests 24. File all required reports with the conference or state in a timely manner 25. Verify each athlete's eligibility prior to the first contest for that sport 26. Distribute eligibility information to the head coach of each sport 27. Distribute eligibility information to system and school level personnel as required 28. Organize and schedule training for coaches as required by the state 29. Collect and maintain all required documentation relative to coaching certification and training 30. Assist in the coordination of the awards program for each sport 31. Plan and supervise a regular program of intramural/extramural/club sports activities for the students 32. Organize and schedule the use of all athletic facilities 33. Maintain an accurate and current inventory of all athletic equipment, supplies, and uniforms 34. Work with the Athletic Director, Principal, and coaches to develop and implement a plan for the maintenance and upkeep of all athletic facilities 35. Develop and maintain a positive public relations program 36. Work with the Athletic Director to promote athletic events and increase attendance 37. Coordinate with the Booster Club on fundraising activities 38. Assist in the recruitment, selection, and assignment of athletic department personnel 39. Ensure that all coaches are properly certified and meet all state and local requirements 40. Evaluate all coaches on a regular basis in accordance with system policy 41. Maintain good public relations with news media, Booster Club, parents, officials, volunteers, and spectators 42. Present information to the news media concerning schedules, tournaments, and results, if needed 43. Perform other duties as assigned by the Athletic Director, Athletic Supervisor, and/or School Principal
WORKING CONDITIONS PHYSICAL DEMANDS Substantial standing, walking, moving, climbing, carrying, bending, kneeling, crawling, reaching, handling, pushing, and pulling. Work is considered moderate physical work requiring the exertion of up to 50 pounds of force. WORK ENVIRONMENT Employees in this position are required to work in indoor and outdoor environments and come into direct contact with OCS staff, students, and the public.

The Head and Assistant MS Women's Soccer Coach role at Blue Ridge Early College - Cashiers emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Head and Assistant MS Women's Soccer Coach coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At Blue Ridge Early College - Cashiers, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The Head and Assistant MS Women's Soccer Coach reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent Blue Ridge Early College - Cashiers at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The Head and Assistant MS Women's Soccer Coach may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The Head and Assistant MS Women's Soccer Coach monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Head and Assistant MS Women's Soccer Coach must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at Blue Ridge Early College - Cashiers.

The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach position at North Farmington High School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach at North Farmington High School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At North Farmington High School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach position at North Farmington High School is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.

Job.JobDescription:
POSITION PURPOSE: The Assistant Coach is responsible for providing appropriate coaching guidance to student-athletes related to a particular sport for the duration of the sports season. As part of the Athletic Program at the assigned school, the Assistant Coach is responsible for teaching and modeling good sportsmanship behaviors, appropriate techniques, and skills related to the particular sport, ensuring safe practices are implemented to protect the students from physical injuries, and serving as good role models for the students, the school, and the school system.
KNOWLEDGE OF POSITION: Thorough knowledge of the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques associated with the athletic program Thorough knowledge of state and federal requirements regarding physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility for athletic participation Thorough knowledge of training rules and any other unique regulations about the various sports in which athletes are engaged Thorough knowledge of guidance and safeguards in place for the safety of athletes to address medical injuries and emergencies Thorough knowledge of the process for initiating policies and procedures applicable to the athletic program
EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE High School Diploma or GED
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (These are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work performed. The omission of specific duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment to the position.) 1. Has a thorough knowledge of all the athletic policies approved by the Orange County Schools Board of Education and is responsible for their implementation 2. Has knowledge of the existing system-wide and conference regulations; implements them consistently 3. Understands the proper administrative line of command and refers all requests or grievances through proper channels. Is aware of all public/staff/departmental meetings that require attendance 4. Maintains discipline, addresses grievances, and works to increase morale and cooperation 5. Assists in the necessary preparation to hold scheduled sport events or practices and adheres to scheduled facility times. Coordinates program with maintenance and school employees 6. Assists in providing documentation to fulfill state and system requirements concerning physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility 7. Provides assistance, guidance, and safeguards for each participant 8. Completes and submits proper documentation to the Athletic Director for out-of-season clinics, camps, workouts, etc. 9. Recommends to the Head Coach the purchase of equipment, supplies, and uniforms as appropriate 10. Maintains necessary attendance forms, insurance records, and similar paperwork 11. Oversees the safety conditions of the facility or area in which assigned sport is conducted at all times that students are present 12. Enforces discipline and sportsmanlike behavior at all times, and establishes and oversees penalties for breach of such standards by individual students 13. Supervises practices, games and team trips 14. Takes an active role in the prevention of drug, alcohol, and tobacco abuse 15. Assist with the collection of the cost of any equipment lost or not returned 16. Assist with issuing and storing equipment and submit an annual inventory and current records to the Head Coach 17. Recommend program area budgetary items for subsequent years to the Head Coach 18. Assist with monitoring and authorizing entrance to equipment rooms and coaches’ offices 19. Assist with examining locker rooms for general cleanliness before and after practices and games 20. Share responsibilities for upkeep and regular care of facilities and fields 21. Assist with ensuring the cleanliness and maintenance of specific sports equipment 22. Assist in securing all doors, lights, windows, and locks before leaving the building if custodians are not on duty 23. Assist with instilling in each player respect for each other, athletic equipment, and school property, including its care and proper use 24. Assist the Head Coach in carrying out their responsibilities 25. Assist with instructing the team members regarding changes in the rules and teaching fundamentals of the sport as outlined by the Head Coach 26. Assist with maintaining a record of team statistics and requirements for lettering (for Head Coach) 27. Work within the basic framework and philosophy of the Head Coach of that sport 28. Attend all staff meetings and carry out scouting assignments as outlined by the Head Coach 29. Arrive early enough before practice, contests, and meetings to assist with preparation adequately and remain long enough afterward to help players with problems and/or be involved in staff discussions 30. Assist with the planning and implementation of both in-season and out-of-season conditioning and weight programs 31. Strive to improve skills by attending clinics and using resources made available by the Head Coach 32. Attend most of the contests, when possible, of other teams in the program 33. Perform other duties as assigned by the Head Coach or Athletic Director
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general purpose and responsibilities assigned to this position. They are not intended to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and skills that may be required of the employees assigned to this position. This description may be revised by the supervisor, with HR review and approval, at any time.
WORKING CONDITIONS PHYSICAL DEMANDS Depending on the sport, work may be considered light to heavy, requiring the exertion of up to 100 pounds of force. Position may require a lot of standing, walking, kneeling, squatting, pushing, pulling, and running.
WORK ENVIRONMENT Employees in this position are required to work in indoor and outdoor environments, with possible exposure to excessive heat and cold, and come into direct contact with OCS staff, students, and the public.

SUMMARY: To help each participating student achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem.

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Experience in physical education, coaching, first-aid, CPR, and sports medicine preferred.
LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of students or employees of the district.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variable sin standardized situations.
OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES: Exhibit qualities of leadership and organizational ability and reflect a spirit of cooperation in working with staff and school administration. Ability to apply knowledge of current research and theory in specific field. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with students, staff and the community. The employee will frequently bend or twist at the truck while performing the duties of this job. The employee will frequently squat, stoop kneel reach above the head, reach forward and repeat the same hand motion many times while performing the duties of the job. The 25-ATH-38 Girls JVB Head Tennis Coach position at North Farmington High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The 25-ATH-38 Girls JVB Head Tennis Coach is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At North Farmington High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The 25-ATH-38 Girls JVB Head Tennis Coach encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The 25-ATH-38 Girls JVB Head Tennis Coach also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the 25-ATH-38 Girls JVB Head Tennis Coach role at North Farmington High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

It is the express intent of this job description to give sufficient guidance to function.
